features: Inspired by the ancient Ayurvedic practice of oil pulling, this sugar and alcohol-free mouthwash helps keep your mouth healthy and your smile bright

Organic Coconut Oil, which helps draw out impurities*, teams up with Zinc Citrate and pure Australian Eco-Harvest Tea Tree Oil to provide powerful defense actions against plaque and cavity-forming sugar acids
A surge of soothing Aloe helps support gum health, while a sweet fusion of Coconut and Mint leaves your breath deliciously fresh
Non-GMO Project Certified, Fluoride Free, Gluten Free, Vegan, Cruelty Free
NO: Parabens, Sodium Lauryl/Laureth Sulfates, phthalates, artificial fragrances or colors, silicones, EDTA, propylene glycol, mineral oil, petrolatum or paraffincids
body.description: Freshen your breath and whiten your smile with the Coconut Oil Whitening Mouthwash from Desert Essence. Desert Essence was founded in 1978 around a simple concept: beauty is natural, and nature is beautiful. By bringing the best of nature's offerings to personal care regimens everywhere, they strive to strengthen the bonds between the planet and all the beings that call it home. Creating a healthy, harmonious relationship with the Earth and community is the foundation for all they do. Desert Essence believes in being responsible to others, honest, and forward-thinking to create and preserve a better future for us all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Recommend...works and tastes great..leave your moth feeling clean and fresh breath not over powering

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stopped using regular mouthwash
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is amazing, I used to use act mouthwash , I stopped my mouth was always dry, my tongue always burned from act mouthwash, I used this it was just amazing I love it my mouth feels fresher my tongue doesn’t burn my teeth aren’t sensitive anymore they are whiter my mouth feels fresher all day and in the morning it feels fresher. It’s cost less. I can’t say enough good stuff about it . There’s no fluoride. I love that. No alcohol, I love that. It’s good for you. It’s healthy stuff. It doesn’t burn. I love it. Just good stuff. Buy this you’ll love. 30 seconds befor you brush so easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars "Meh" taste, decent product
reviews.reviewText: This mouthwash has a funny taste to it. I chalk it up to it being all natural and eco friendly. I've been trying to make more eco conscious purchases, and wanted to give this mouthwash a try in my morning routine. It does not have a great fresh taste like the usual mouthwashes I've used and am used to, but if you can get over the flavor it is still a worth while product. As far as the whitening aspect claimed in the description I'm not sure I can vouch for that, but it may just be that my teeth are already in a good white condition, as I care for them more than the average person. But by all means this is a decent product, and if you're fine with the trade off of taste for the environment, then I'm right there with you brother!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Refreshing Mouth Rinse That Improves Sore Gums!
reviews.reviewText: I'm very pleased with this natural mouth rinse since it gets the job done and the flavor and scent are pleasant and not overpowering. It helps to remove bits of food that might get stuck in my gums (even after tooth brushing and flossing), and I've seen remarkable improvement in my gums. I've been a customer and fan of the manufacturer, Desert Essence, for many years, and I'm so glad they have created this product. Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's Tastes So Awful I Can't Force Myself to Use It
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a rinse to use at bedtime to clean and protect my teeth overnight. The directions say to swish it in your mouth for 30 seconds. I can't go past 10 seconds before I start wanting to gag. That's just me. Others may find it quite tolerable. Mine is still sitting by my bedside almost full. I just can't make myself use it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this product!
reviews.reviewText: I am very familiar with the desert essence facial products but was surprised to see they have a coconut oil mouthwash, that is alcohol free. I love this product it is very effective and leaves my mouth feeling clean and fresh.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not what I expected
reviews.reviewText: Bought this because of sensitivity to alcohol in other brands. First, it's kind of watery for having coconut oil in it. It doesn't taste good but I could get past that if it didn't irritate my gums just as much as the alcoholic famous brand mouthwash I used to use. I trusted the desert essence brand but in this product they dropped the ball IMHO. First ingredient WATER. Second ingedient GLYCERIN. Third ingredient POLYSORBATE 80. A preservative? I suspect you might be better off rinsing your mouth with certain pantry staples. One more thing: It's expensive for the size. 16 oz. It's opened. It's going down the drain. Money wasted. Lesson learned.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I had been oil pulling with basic coconut oil but this mouth wash is great. The flavor is nice too. Will buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it ! Great oil pulling wash
reviews.reviewText: Coconut oil mouth wash is for oil pulling. FYI 20 min in your mouth to get the toxins out of your body. Don't give stuff bad reviews because your not using it right. I love the taste of it very refreshing.

It tastes so foul, I gagged on it. It tastes like plastic smells. Also, it's is NOT for oil pulling as one reviewer states. It's mostly water with some coconut oil added but it is not pure coconut oil. Oil pulling is done with only pure oil, not with watered down oil. As well, the instructions only say to rinse for a minute. Oil pulling is for 20 minutes. Outrageous price for mostly water. And I suspect the bad taste is from pepper. Why on earth did they have to put pepper in a mouthwash?
Has a natural flavor with no burning sensation. My mouth doesn't feel very refreshed afterwards.
